= Introduction =
Visualize History is not in the business of indexing and storing the world's historical information.  Rather, it uses the many existing sites and their public interfaces to find historical data.

= Sources =
 * UVA
  * [http://valley.vcdh.virginia.edu/reference/timelines/timelines.html The Valley of the Shadow]
 * The History Place
  * [http://www.historyplace.com/civilwar/index.html Civil War Timeline]
 * MIT: Simile Project
  * Timeline
   * [http://simile.mit.edu/timeline/examples/religions/jewish-history.html Jewish History]
   * [http://simile.mit.edu/timeline/examples/religions/christianity.html Christian History]
  * Exhibit
   * [http://simile.mit.edu/exhibit/examples/presidents/ American Presidents]
 * [http://www.census.gov/population/www/censusdata/hiscendata.html U.S. Census Historical Data]
  * Foreign-born population (1850 - 1990)
  * Population by race (1790 - 1990)
  * Urban vs. Rural population (1930 - 2000)
  * Population of the 100 largest cities
